title: P.A.T.H. (Planning Alternative Tomorrows with Hope)
description: Visual planning for complex futures, focusing on long-term aspirations and backward mapping.

stages.label: 1. The North Star (Dream)
stages.ai_prompt: Ask the child/family: 'Imagine a future where everything has gone right. Who is with you? What are you doing? How does it feel?' Focus on vivid imagery.

stages.label: 2. Goals (Positive & Possible)
stages.ai_prompt: Identify concrete milestones for the next year. 'If the North Star is the destination, what does the halfway point look like?'

stages.label: 3. The Situation Now
stages.ai_prompt: Contrast the dream with today's reality. 'What is factual about today? What is already working? What is hard?'

stages.label: 4. Who to Enrol
stages.ai_prompt: Identify the team. 'Who needs to help to make this dream happen? Family, Professionals, Friends?'

stages.label: 5. Getting Stronger
stages.ai_prompt: Identify resilience factors. 'What skills or knowledge do we need to build to survive the journey?'

stages.label: 6. First Steps
stages.ai_prompt: Define immediate actions for the next 24-48 hours. 'What is one small thing we can do tomorrow?'

title: M.A.P.S. (Making Action Plans)
description: A collaborative process to build a shared vision for the student's inclusion.

stages.label: 1. History / The Story
stages.ai_prompt: Ask for the background. 'Tell me the story of [Name] so far. Key milestones, high points, and low points.'

stages.label: 2. The Dream
stages.ai_prompt: Ask about aspirations. 'What is your greatest hope for [Name] in the future?'

stages.label: 3. The Nightmare
stages.ai_prompt: Address fears directly. 'What is your worst fear for [Name] if things don't change?' (Crucial for identifying risks)

stages.label: 4. Who is [Name]?
stages.ai_prompt: Brainstorm descriptors. 'What words describe [Name]? Focus on gifts, strengths, and personality.'

stages.label: 5. Needs
stages.ai_prompt: Identify what is required. 'What does [Name] need to avoid the nightmare and move towards the dream?'

stages.label: 6. Action Plan
stages.ai_prompt: Agree on specifics. 'Who will do what, and by when?'

title: Complex Case (Hypothesis Testing)
description: A scientific method for unpicking persistent barriers through hypothesis formulation.

stages.label: 1. Problem Clarification
stages.ai_prompt: Ask specific questions to define the frequency, intensity, and duration of the concern. Move away from vague descriptions.

stages.label: 2. Data & Context
stages.ai_prompt: Review the Subject 360 history. Ask: 'When does this behavior not happen?' (Exception hunting).

stages.label: 3. Hypothesis Generation
stages.ai_prompt: Formulate a working hypothesis. Is this 'Can't do' (Skill deficit) or 'Won't do' (Performance deficit)?

stages.label: 4. Intervention Design
stages.ai_prompt: Design a SMART intervention to test the hypothesis. Ensure it is time-bound.

title: Multi-Agency (TAC/TAS)
description: Statutory Team Around the Child meeting structure for complex health & social needs.

stages.label: 1. Role & Remit
stages.ai_prompt: Clarify who is present. Ask Health and Social Care colleagues for their statutory advice updates.

stages.label: 2. Joint Needs Analysis
stages.ai_prompt: Triangulate the school's concern with the medical/social context. Identify cross-agency patterns.

stages.label: 3. Outcome Agreement
stages.ai_prompt: Agree on 'Long Term Outcomes' (Section E of EHCP). Ensure they are specific and aspiring.

stages.label: 4. Provision Assignment
stages.ai_prompt: Who pays for what? Assign specific provisions to specific agencies (Health vs Education budget).
